item.title: Enhancements to Numba's guvectorize decorator
item.description: Note: This article originally appeared in Quansight Labs blog.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Work Hi, my name is Guilherme Leobas. I am currently working at @quansightai as a Software Engineer. Before joining Quansight, I was a MSc student at the Federal University of Minas Gerais (dcc/ufmg) working with compiler optimizations under the supervision of professor Fernando Magno. As part of my work at Quansight, I have contributed to a number of open source softwares: Numba, a NumPy aware JIT compiler using LLVM RBC, a remote JIT compiler built on top of Numba OmniSciDB, one of the fastest SQL engine in the world PyTorch, an open source ML framework Free time I am also an amateur triathlete.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Benchmarks - A collection of more than 220 benchmarks used by compilers engineers to measure compiler optimizations. TF - A simple test framework built using bash to compile, instrument and profile benchmarks. cftool - Get inputs and outputs for a specific problem or contest on Codeforces or URI. IRView - Generate dot/pdf files of llvm IR from Sublime Text

item.title: Publications
item.description: Guilherme Vieira Leobas and Fernando Magno Quintão Pereira. Semiring Optimizations: Dynamic Elision of Expressions with Identity and Absorbing Elements. OOPSLA 2020. Caio Lima, Junio Cezar, Guilherme Vieira Leobas, Erven Rohou and Fernando Magno Quintão Pereira. Guided Just-in-Time Specialization. Science of Computer Programming, 185, 2020. Fernando Magno Quintão Pereira, Guilherme Vieira Leobas and Abdoulaye Gamatié. Static Prediction of Silent Stores. ACM Transactions on Architecture and Code Optimization.
